other_tests.findings: Intestinal calcium absorption was extremely elevated, with 95% absorption from low-calcium feed and 85% from normal-calcium feed.
Three large regions of homozygosity on chromosomes 7, 16, and 20 were revealed.
A single amino acid deletion in CYP24A1 was found; no additional non-synonymous coding variants or whole-gene deletions were found in 27 children with infantile hypercalcemia.
24,25(OH)2D was undetectable at both 17 months and 39 months; age-matched control subjects had detectable levels.
